item.title: 2.1. Planning - Envision
item.description:
2. Overview

This stage is where we have a user profile for an ideal user and also this stage is the middle stage of coming up with the idea and making the idea. So we invest time in this stage and do not go to prototying or visual stage without completing this stage of the idea.

Here we use semi-visual i.e; words and diagrams to articulate our ideas…

  • Planning
  • Testing
  • Researching
  • Mapping
graph LR; 
    App-Idea-- using words-->Envision;
    Envision--words, maps, skteches -->Prototype;

app idea (words) -> envision (words, maps, sketches) -> prototype (experience, final design) non-visual -> semi visual -> visual

2.1. Envision :

flowchart LR;
mapping(Mapping content) <--> development(Developing ideas);
development(Developing ideas)<-->paperprotptyping(Prototype testing);
paperprotptyping(Prototype testing)<-->visualdevelopment(Wireframe & UI);
  • This stage we are still developing the content and ideas. We can still change things at this stage. Be more analytical and critical about what can work and what will not work?
  • As the arrows in the flowchart indicate we can move front and back on any stage of the development until refined and accepeted to meet the required market needs

Note: here we are going to come up with different functionalities of the app i.e; for eg: add a recipe (how the user is going to add it?)

Note: this functionality will be added later after content mapping. So that each individual feature is explained in further detail. We also need to explore more feasible tech to do certain task with ease !
  • In the next page we will see the content mapping.

item.title: 2.2 Mapping Content & Interaction
item.description:
2.2 Mapping Content and Interaction

This page is mostly dedicated to writing content mapping and interaction via flowchart or sequence diagram using mermaid. For more advanced we can use other online editor’s such as draw.io

2.2.1 Mapping Content:

In this section we focus only on developing the content on each page of the app.

We follow the rules defined below for defining our content mapping.

RULES:

  • we use flowchart graphs for different pages.
  • subgraphs to map each content of a particular page - if it requires anything.
  • arrow heads represents moving to different page.
  • without arrow head represents line in the same page.
  • color codes for different elements of the flowchart will evolve as we work.
Note: more rules may be added if and when required to better represent this phase of our work.
2.2.2.1 Major components of App:

The 4 major components of the applications are the following:

  1. Welcome page - contents
  2. Food
  3. Exercise
  4. Wellness - (Mood/Stress level)

1. Welcome Page:

This is the page when the user enters, sees the welcome message and statistics for the day.
